title: CBT Nuggets F5 BIG-IP Local Traffic Manager
description:
CBT Nuggets F5 BIG-IP Local Traffic Manager


This course is designed to explain to, demonstrate to, and assist learners in building their own lab topology to learn the skills and
understanding necessary for the day-to-day management of the F5 BIG-IP Application Delivery Controller (ADC) appliance, including the Local Traffic Manager (LTM) module
It also will assist those who are preparing to become a certified F5 BIG-IP administrator

Recommended skills:

Intermediate understanding of IPv4 networking, along with the protocols and services used on those networks
Familiarity with VMware virtualization

Recommended equipment:

Computer with at least 8 Gigs of RAM
VMware Workstation, version 10 or newer

Related certifications:

Certified F5 BIG-IP Administrator (F5-CA, exams 101 and 201)

Related job functions:

Network engineer
Load Balancer/ADC architect
Administrator
Engineer

The 101 Application Delivery Fundamentals exam, along with the 201 TMOS Administration exam
are both required to become a Certified F5 BIG-IP Administrator. This course presumes basic knowledge of IPv4 networking as a prerequisite
and then focuses on the concepts and methods to deploy and management an F5 Application Delivery Controller (ADC) in an Application Delivery Network (ADN)
This course walks you through the step by step process of how to build your own lab environment, and practice what you see in the videos
This will assist you in mastering the F5 technologies by you practicing hands on
